sites.name: Tivoli Gardens
sites.description: Tivoli Gardens, one of the oldest amusement parks in the world, opened in 1843. It is famous for its vintage roller coasters, beautiful flower gardens, and evening illuminations. The park hosts concerts and events throughout the year and is a beloved cultural icon in Copenhagen.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open from April to September and during Christmas. It gets crowded during summer and holiday seasons.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online to avoid long queues, especially during peak seasons.

sites.name: Nyhavn
sites.description: Nyhavn is a 17th-century waterfront, canal, and entertainment district. Known for its brightly colored 17th and early 18th-century townhouses, it was once a bustling commercial port but is now lined with restaurants and bars.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular all year, especially during summer and Christmas for its markets.
sites.booking_tips: No booking necessary to visit the area; reservations recommended for dining.

sites.name: The Little Mermaid
sites.description: The Little Mermaid statue is an iconic symbol of Copenhagen, inspired by Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tale. The bronze statue, created by Edvard Eriksen, has been a major tourist attraction since 1913.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, but early mornings are less crowded.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Consider visiting early to avoid crowds.

sites.name: Rosenborg Castle
sites.description: Rosenborg Castle is a renaissance castle built as a country summerhouse in 1606 and is one of the most well-preserved buildings of its era. It houses the Danish crown jewels and royal regalia.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open all year, though hours may vary during winter. It's less crowded during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be bought online, especially during peak tourist seasons to ensure entry.

sites.name: Amalienborg Palace
sites.description: Amalienborg is the home of the Danish royal family and consists of four identical classical palace fa√ßades around an octagonal courtyard. It is famous for its Royal Guard ceremony.
sites.seasonal_notes: The changing of the guard happens daily and is a major attraction.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to save time. Arrive early for a good view of the guard ceremony.

sites.name: The National Museum of Denmark
sites.description: The National Museum offers a comprehensive overview of Danish history and culture, featuring exhibits from the Stone Age to the modern era, including Viking artifacts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; typically less crowded on weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking is recommended to avoid queues, especially during weekends.

sites.name: Christiansborg Palace
sites.description: Christiansborg Palace is the seat of the Danish Parliament, the Prime Minister's Office, and the Supreme Court. Visitors can explore the royal reception rooms, the ruins beneath the palace, and the royal stables.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with varied hours during winter.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking is recommended to explore the royal reception rooms.

sites.name: The Round Tower
sites.description: Built in the 17th century, the Round Tower is Europe's oldest functioning observatory. Its unique spiral ramp and panoramic views of Copenhagen make it a must-visit.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; views are best on clear days.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased on-site; visiting on weekdays can avoid weekend crowds.

sites.name: Frederik's Church (The Marble Church)
sites.description: Known for its impressive rococo architecture, Frederik's Church has the largest church dome in Scandinavia with a span of 31 meters. It is a key religious and architectural landmark.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; less crowded in the mornings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.

sites.name: The Glyptotek
sites.description: Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek is an art museum that houses a vast collection of ancient and modern art, including works by Rodin and a significant collection of Roman and Greek sculptures.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; less crowded on weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online; consider visiting on a weekday for a quieter experience.

sites.name: Copenhagen Opera House
sites.description: The Copenhagen Opera House is one of the most modern opera houses in the world, known for its stunning architecture and world-class productions. Situated on the island of Holmen, it offers breathtaking views of the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with a varied program; tickets for performances can sell out quickly.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance for popular performances.

sites.name: Freetown Christiania
sites.description: Christiania is a self-proclaimed autonomous neighborhood in Copenhagen, known for its unique community, art, and alternative lifestyle. It‚Äôs a vibrant area with cafes, music venues, and galleries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, with more activities during warmer months.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours are available for a deeper understanding.

sites.name: Stroget
sites.description: Stroget is one of Europe's longest pedestrian streets, lined with shops ranging from budget-friendly chains to high-end boutiques. It's a central hub for shopping and dining in Copenhagen.
sites.seasonal_notes: Bustling year-round; particularly busy during sales and holiday seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; visit in the morning for fewer crowds.

sites.name: Kastellet
sites.description: Kastellet is one of the best-preserved star fortresses in Northern Europe. It is a peaceful green oasis with historical buildings and a windmill, perfect for a scenic walk.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; ideal for a stroll during spring and summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.

sites.name: Carlsberg Brewery
sites.description: The Carlsberg Brewery, founded in 1847, is a historic brewery that offers tours covering the history of Carlsberg beer, brewing processes, and samples.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; less crowded during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online for tours, especially during weekends.

sites.name: The Botanical Garden
sites.description: Copenhagen's Botanical Garden is a haven for plant enthusiasts, featuring over 13,000 species. The garden includes historical glasshouses and a beautiful lake.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in spring and summer when flowers are in full bloom.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.

sites.name: Louisiana Museum of Modern Art
sites.description: Located just north of Copenhagen, the Louisiana Museum of Modern Art is renowned for its contemporary art collection, sculptures, and scenic location overlooking the √òresund Strait.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; busiest during special exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online. Plan a full day trip to explore both the art and the surrounding landscape.

sites.name: Church of Our Saviour
sites.description: Famous for its spiral tower with external staircase, the Church of Our Saviour offers panoramic views of Copenhagen. The baroque church is an architectural masterpiece completed in 1695.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; tower access may be closed during bad weather.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets for the tower can be purchased on-site; arrive early to avoid queues.

sites.name: The Royal Danish Playhouse
sites.description: A modern architectural masterpiece, the Royal Danish Playhouse hosts a range of theatrical performances and offers stunning views of the harbor.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with a varied program; winter performances are popular.
sites.booking_tips: Booking in advance is recommended for popular shows.

sites.name: The David Collection
sites.description: The David Collection is a unique museum that houses one of the largest collections of Islamic art in Scandinavia, alongside European 18th-century art and Danish Early Modern art.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; quieter during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.
